findings.title: Owner privileges (In the period when the owner is not renounced)
findings.description: The contract owner has excessive privileges to modify critical settings and withdraw BNBs, which can lead to unintended consequences if the owner account is compromised.

findings.title: Modifiers onlyToken and onlyOwner can be exploited
findings.description: The modifiers onlyToken and onlyOwner can be exploited to unauthorized access or manipulation of contract functions.
findings.function: Multiple Functions (setDistributionCriteria, setShare, deposit, process, setTxLimit, setIsDividendExempt, setIsFeeExempt, setIsTxLimitExempt, setFees, setFeeReceivers, setSwapBackSettings, setTargetLiquidity, setDistributionCriteria, setDistributorSettings)

findings.title: Unprotected Functions
findings.description: The functions setDistributionCriteria, setShare, deposit, process, distributeDividend, claimDividend, addShareholder, removeShareholder, approve, approveMax, transfer, transferFrom, setMaxWalletPercent, takeFee, and clearStuckBalance are unprotected.
